message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.SE, cs.AI, cs.SI

The paper discusses penetration testing and mitigation analysis, which are both related to computer security. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also mentions network modeling and automated attack-finding, which are related to computer networks and could fall under cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper proposes a method for conducting what-if analyses, which involves simulation and optimization, and could be considered as a form of artificial intelligence, hence cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is also a likely category. The paper also discusses the prioritization of counter-measures, which could be considered as a software engineering problem and fall under cs.SE (Software Engineering). Finally, the paper proposes a well-founded basis for a holistic mitigation strategy, which could be considered as a systems engineering problem and fall under cs.SI (Systems and Control).
